name: Dvd "The Hard-Ons vs. Europe 2007"
description: Docu-Roadmovie (live numbers and interviews of the Hard-Ons in Europe 2007) PAL dvd (if you live outside region 2, make sure you can play this before ordering) 70 MIN DOCUMENTARY Please note this is available in PAL version only so we cannot guarantee playability outside PAL regions, and is a professionally printed DVD-R format.

name: Book "Ramones Sniffing Poster"
description:
Book 
"Ramones Sniffing Poster"
di Marco Zuanelli e Martino Pasina
2013, Espressione Editore

Sniff this! "Ramones sniffing poster" traces the history of the Ramones since 1975 through a collection of over 350 posters of concerts, promotion, solo projects, movies and magazines.
 
With words by: Marky Ramone, CJ Ramone, Richie Ramone, Daniel Rey, Monte A. Melnick (Ramones tour manager), Arturo Vega (Ramones graphic designer), George DuBose (photographer), John Holmstrom (Punk magazine) and interviews with the artists  TAZ, Mark Arminski, Derek Hess, Mark Matcho, William Stout, Ben Harris and other interviews with The Manges, Florian Hayler (Ramones Museum Berlin), Paolo Di Gaetano and Maurizio Nodari (The Ramones Italian official fan club). 

320 colored pages, 12" x 8", language Italian/English

name: CD The Manges "Bad Juju"
description:
CD
The Manges "Bad Juju"
2010, Tre Accordi/Self (IT), Monster Zero (NL)
Produced by Joe King

01.Stalag 17/Good Morning Campers
02.Hit The Punchball
03.Bad Juju
04.M.I.A.
05.Motion Picture Rest Home
06.Back To The Training Camp
07.The Last Of The Savages
08.Good Boy Bad Time
09.Sgt. Mouse Bad March
10.Storming Out
11.Serenity Now!
12.You Don't Wanna Be Like Me

Bad juju makes punk rock good; THE MANGES make Italy proud. La Spezia four piece’s brand new album was recorded in Atlanta by Joe King, voice and soul of The Quees, and features a couple of songs written by Ben Weasel and Dan Vapid of Screeching Weasel/ Riverdales. The result of this punk rock partnership and friendship is a bunch of fast and melodic tunes, in the vein of the mighty Ramones.
(Tre Accordi Records)

Graphic design by Mass Mosrite

<iframe width="345" height="194" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/Ls1k0FkHjMU" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

With those crazy Canadian boys the MCRACKINS and their Eggs and Chicken charm and those punk popsters from Europe The MANGESyou can't go wrong with this release. The Mcrackins do 10 songs and The Manges do 9 songs. This is a must have for any fan of fun sing a long punk rock.

name: CD The Veterans s/t
description:
LAST COPIES!

CD
The Veterans
2008, It's Alive Records (USA)

01 - I Think It's So Cool
02 - Charlie And The Surfboard Factory
03 - Be True To Your School
04 - Easter Island UFO
05 - Oceanside Park
06 - Dance, Darling, Dance
07 - Hula Girl
08 - Sick Vibrations
09 - Surfer's Holiday
10 - The Tiki Art Show

<iframe width="345" height="194" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/qv3Caw1o1dw" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

Andrea Caredda, front man for Italy's best Ramones inspired punk rock band The Manges, has put together a classic summertime album of beach inspired tunes for all the pogo pop fanatics the world over. For this mission he enlisted the help of friends from all over the world from bands including Supermarket and The Popsters from Italy, Surfin' Lungs from The UK, and The Leftovers from the USA. Sure, this style of pop has been around for years and has been done many times before, but it's not often it is done this well. The ten tracks on this debut album from The Veterans are as catchy as they come!
(It's Alive Records)

Graphic design by Mass Mosrite

name: LP "The Manges 'R' Good Enough" remastered
description:
LP 
"The Manges 'R' Good Enough"
Out March 31, 2012 remastered edition, Surfin' Ki Records (ITALY) with Striped.
Originally released in 2001 by Stardumb Records (NL).

DOWNLOAD CODE NOW INCLUDED!

[from Surfin' Ki]
The Manges "R Good Enough", originally released by the great label Stardumb Rec, is now available again on Surfin' Ki! The album has been remastered by Johnny Love (the same guy who worked on the Manges' latest album Bad Juju) and now it sounds like a new record!

SIDE A: 
1. I'm A Monkey 
2. Blame Game 
3. Elvis Has Left The Building 
4. I'll Take You To Hawaii 
5. I Hate Rats (feat Joe King of the Queers) 
6. 80's Soldier

Side B: 
7. Kids Are At The Mall 
8. Miss Evil 
9. Now Or Never 
10. Goonies 'R' Good Enough (feat. Kitty Kowalski)
11. Rumble In Chinatown 
12. Yeah (Late Nite Song)

The release is limited to 400 copies - 200 on black wax, 100 on solid blue wax and 100 on clear white wax (Tree Chord Fest edition).

Graphic design by Mass Mosrite

Bad juju makes punk rock good; THE MANGES make Italy proud. La Spezia four piece’s brand new album was recorded in Atlanta by Joe King, voice and soul of The Quees, and features a couple of songs written by Ben Weasel and Dan Vapid of Screeching Weasel/ Riverdales. name: LP The Manges "Rocket To Hollywood" - Live June 2007
description:
LP 12"
The Manges "Rocket To Hollywood"
2008 It's Alive Records (USA)
IAR 31

01 - Secret Agent In East Berlin
02 - Barrage Of Hate
03 - Havana Affair
04 - Vengeance Is Mine
05 - Oh, Mary!
06 - She's A Punk
07 - My Direction
08 - I Don't Wanna Live In Hell
09 - I'm A Monkey
10 - My Rifle
11 - The Only Cool Girl In Ladbroke Grove
12 - Gimme Gimme Shock Treatment
13 - Wonder Wheel
14 - Blame Game
15 - Ten Shots

The Manges bring a ton of energy and excellent musicianship with them every time they take a stage. Much like their heroes the Ramones they make every live show count. This live album plays more like a greatest hits or best of album - all hits without any misses. There are a couple of Ramones covers thrown in for good measure, of course. Rocket To Hollywood was recorded during the summer of 2007 at Safari Sams in Hollywood, CA while on their third tour of the states, this time with The Queers and The Methadones. It was a great show start to finish and this recording captured the fun-loving spirit of the night perfectly.
[www.itsaliverecords.com]

Art by Sponge
Graphic design by Mass Mosrite

name: 7" Kitty and the Manges
description:
7" 
Kitty & The Manges "Joey's Song"
2006, It's Alive Records (USA)
IAR 04 

01 - Joey's Song
02 - Elvis Has Left The Building
03 - The Goonies R Good Enough

The Manges are more than a band, they're a punk rock institution! They've been keeping the blitzkrieg beat alive for more than 12 years now. For this release the striped army have recruited NYC's Kitty Kowalski for lead vocal duties - she's got voice and a style of singing that are like an echo of Punk Rock's past. Put the two together and you've got a combo that can't be beat! The three songs on this release feature what is probably the best tribute song to Joey Ramone ever penned ("Joey's Song), a duet with Andrea and Kitty ("Elvis Has Left The Building"), and a cover song that's good enough for you (The Goonies R Good Enough")! It's Alive counts itself very lucky to have become part of the Manges extensive 7" catalog.
[www.itsaliverecords.com]

Graphic design by Mass Mosrite

name: CD The 20Belows "For Better Days"
description:
CD
The 20Belows "For Better Days"
Monster Zero Records (NL)

Tracklisting:
01 - Saying Sorry
02 - What A Nightmare
03 - Through The City
04 - 20/20
05 - Oh Baby
06 - Resign
07 - The Inevitable Knockdown
08 - Like A Chokeslam
09 - One Good Reason
10 - The Only Excuse
11 - For Better Days
12 - Double Gin
13 - Whenever You Go

Forget about all those trendy bands from Scandinavia! Monster Zero brings you the 20Belows. Their debut record on Whoa Oh Records was already really good, but with the release of ‘For Better Days’, the 4 amigos from Copenhagen bring their sound to a new level. Songs about the unhappy side of love. Poppunk with a tear in your beer. But it’s not your average 1-2-3-4 i want my baby back boo-hoo! Take your Queers and Weasel, throw in a little Jawbreaker and Radio With Guts, add a little Dead To Me, and walk bare-foot over 10.000 pieces of Lego. Now wish for better days.
(Monster Zero Records)

name: CD The Apers "Live At The Eldorado"
description: Live CD The Apers "Live At The Eldorado" 2012, Asian Man Records (USA) Tracklist: 1. It's All Over, You Know 2. Word Is Out 3. Reanimate My Heart 4. N210 5. Wait A Little Longer 6. Endless Nightmare 7. Friday Night Killed Saturday Fun 8. Eyes Wide Open 9. Teenage Kicks 10. Only The Grim Reaper 11. Too Many Backpacks at the Show 12. Herr Autobahn 13. At the Eldorado 14. I Hope You Feel The Same 15. Whatever It Takes 16. Everyday Is A Rock'n Roll Day After 15 years of playing all over the globe, the Rotterdam punkrockers of The Apers have finally managed to record a live record! Listen to the band crank out their hits in front of a small audience at The Eldorado in Nordenham, Germany! Recorded by The Apers, D.I.Y. Fuck yeah!!!

name: CD Deecracks "Attention! Deficit Disorder"
description:
CD 
Deecracks "Attention! Deficit Disorder"
Monster Zero Records (NL)

Tracklisting:
01 - I Wanted It All
02 - Monkey Boy
03 - Not Another Minute
04 - The Hangover Hop
05 - Waiting For You
06 - Ritalin For Lunch
07 - It Has Always Been This Way
08 - Gimme Gimme Plastic Surgery
09 - Dairy Queen King
10 - She Met A Brat
11 - I Need A Nurse
12 - Ratface
13 - Radioactive Kiss
14 - I See You Around

Do you wanna be a monkey boy, take some Ritalin for lunch and do the hangover hop? Than here’s you motherflippin’ soundtrack! The first full-length from DeeCracks is oozing with Ramones influenced party hits! 14 tracks in the greater poppunk tradition, so familiar, yet fresh and exciting. One moment you’re doing the pogo, a second later you’ll be hand in hand with the hottest punkrock girl at the show. From beginning ‘till end, this record grabs you by the cojones and drags you down to basement. Leather jacket – check! Hi-top chucks – check! Attention! Deficit Disorder – double check!
(Monster Zero Records)

name: CD The Murderburgers "Burned Out / Worn Out"
description:
CD 
The Murderburgers "Burned Out / Worn Out"
Monster Zero Records (NL)

Tracklisting:
01 - Eyes On Her
02 - Lump In My Throat
03 - Beer, Don’t Fail Me Now
04 - Burned Out/Worn Out
05 - Sickness In My Head
06 - I Don’t Want To Have To Entertain You
07 - Braindead (From Hanging Round With You)
08 - I’ve Got A Plan (To Kill You)
09 - Ugly As Sin
10 - Don’t Patronise Me
11 - Easy Come Easy Go
12 - Outta My Mind
13 - Eh? Huh? Wha?
14 - I Hope That’s It

The boys from Glasgow are back with their 2nd full-length on Monster Zero. With their first one in 2009, The Murderburgers from Scotland stole the hearts of the worldwide poppunk scene, and with their newest ‘Burned Out / Worn Out’ they have no intention on giving those back. Another 14 stompers in the greater Lillingtons tradition. Fraser Murderburger has issues with love and life in general and likes to inform you on those topics. At Monster Zero we’re pretty sure that the ladies will be lining up after hearing this record. Is it that good? Yes!
(Monster Zero Records)

name: CD The Murderburgers "How To Ruin Your Life"
description: CD The Murderburgers "How To Ruin Your Life" 2012, Monster Zero (NL) Tracklisting: 01 - It's Burger Time 02 - Unemployment, Here I Come 03 - My Head Is Fucked Again 04 - I Don't Wanna Dance With You Tonight 05 - You'll Have No Fun Without Me 06 - Broken Brain 07 - Moron 08 - It's Over Already 09 - Gimme Gimme Negativity 10 - Drifting Apart 11 - She Better Stop Killing Me 12 - I Don't Live Well 13 - She Don't Wanna 14 - Valentine's Day 2009 15 - Learning To Hate You The third Murderburgers full-length on Monster Zero is in full-a-fect! More songs about being flat broke and going mental, but recorded waaaaay better! And mastered by the legendary Mass Giorgini. The Scots did it again!

Recorded at Convolution Studio (Ravenna-IT), June and September 2011.
Recorded and mixed by Alex Conti, engineered by Alex Conti, Raffaele Torelli and Lorenzo Gulminelli. 
Support, advices and cigarette breaks by Andrea Manges.
All songs written by The Ponches, lyrics by A. De Feo and L. Bravi, except for “The long goodbye” (A. De Feo, L. Bravi, A. Caredda).
“You ain’t seen nothing yet” written by R. Bachman.
Additional vocals on “Korean ships on the horizon” and “Easy come easy go” by Andrea Manges.

description:
CD
The Priceduifkes "Can't Lose"
2011, Monster Zero Records (NL)

Tracklisting:
01 - Puke For Breakfast
02 - Break Stuff
03 - Stuck
04 - I'd Rather Be In The Jizzhut Tonight
05 - Bye Bye Love
06 - Trainwreck
07 - Start Dricking
08 - Frogprince
09 - I.K.A.W.

From Belgium, where guys take of there shirts and party till you have to go back to work on monday and where the girls leave you smitten and sometimes heartbroken. This is where The Priceduifkes are hailing from. These guys are partying with Goomba and Koopa Troopa for years and we are happy to release this CD full of fast catchy Punkrock songs that will keep you dancing all nite long. The Priceduifkes love the sounds of The Nobody's, old Queers tunes and The Dwarfes and probably a million other bands, O, and the Flippo's.
(Monster Zero Records)

name: CD The Roman Line "Morning Portraits"
description:
CD 
The Roman Line "Morning Portraits"
Monster Zero Records (NL)
Produced by Joe King

Tracklisting:
01 - Intro
02 - Dawn After The Wreck
03 - No Vacancy
04 - My Dear Wilmarth
05 - Jimmy
06 - With Friends Like You, Who Needs Firewood
07 - You Fuck Off First, Then I’ll Fuck Off
08 - Dark Days In Monkey Town
09 - Worst Case Ontario
10 - Stickin’Together Is What Good Waffles Do
11 - Talbot & Inkerman
12 - If These Walls Could Talk

The first non-European release on Monster Zero is ‘Morning Portraits’ by The Roman Line from Toronto, Canada. It’s their debut record, but it’s so motherflippin good! The four-piece went into the studio with none other than Joe Queer to record these 12 brand new tracks. Taking the best elements of punkrock, rock n roll and country, The Roman Line hits you where it hurts, right in the heart! As if the Boss was rockin’ out with Screeching Weasel! Singer Pod has a great, intense voice, that is raw and direct. Whoever said Canadians are stupid? ‘Morning Portraits is well-produced, well-written, well-composed, and there’s a hot, tattoed chick on the cover! Get it now, eh!
(Monster Zero Records)

name: LP Kepi Ghoulie "I Bleed Rock'n'Roll" limited European press
description: LP 12" Kepi Ghoulie "I Bleed Rock'n'Roll" Limited European press - Otis Recordings (ITA) 01. Rock'n'Roll Shark 02. Nikki Lee 03. I Bleed Rock'n'Roll 04. The Fever 05. Part Time Romeo 06. When I'm Gone 07. Unfigureoutable 08. I Just Wanted You to Know 09. Love To Give 10. Break My Heart 11. Cupid Is Real 12. Blame It on Mom 13. Hard to Forget KEPI GHOULIE is back with more amazing punk rock, and with his best record since Groovie Ghoulies' "Fun in the Dark", everyone says so! This is bubblegum pop punk in the vein of the RAMONES meets the DICKIES and add a bit of T REX too!! Thirteen amazing tracks, with new live-show classics such as "I Bleed Rock'n'Roll", "Part-time Romeo" and "The Fever" !! The spirit of Punk-Rock lives in Kepi, one of the few real heroes of this genre nowadays, still touring full-time all over the world, writing beautiful songs and spreading the essence of real Rock'n'Roll!! This is the limited European press, printed by Otis Tours for his 2012 tour. 500 copies only, with 160 gr vinyl, heavy cardboard sleeve, poster with all the lyrics, and new improved layout!!

name: LP The Leeches "Underwater"
description:
LP 
OTIS 003
The Leeches "Underwater"
2012, Otis Recordings (ITA)

Tracklist:
A
01. I'm Everything To Me 
02. Piranha Boys
03. Serious
04. Feelin' Alright Tonight
05. Down On My Knees
06. Vanilla Coke
B
01. Stop The Clock
02. Nothing At All
03. Standing On My Tomb
04. My Life
05. Too Hungry To Pray
06. ME-262
07. Into The Storm

I quattro comaschi, artefici di quello che tanti hanno definito "fat rock", giungono al quarto album: Underwater.
Per l’occasione, la band ha chiamato dietro al mixer un produttore degno di rilievo mondiale nel circuito punk rock: il newyorkese Daniel Rey, autore e produttore di molti brani dei Ramones.
“Underwater” riprende un percorso intrapreso nel precedente lavoro “Get Serious”, qui progredito in uno stile compositivo decisamente maturo, definendo ormai come “inconfondibile” l’impronta stilistica dei Leeches, da alcuni etichettata come “Fat Rock”.
Dodici brani (e una cover dei Blue Öyster Cult) dediti al punk rock’n’roll di chiara matrice americana senza mai superare i tre minuti. Un disco gioioso ma anche scuro, divertente e terrorizzante che parla di tempeste, creature marine, piranha e di acqua come energia di vita, ma anche di morte, guerra, zombie, diete e vaniglia. Insomma, un bel calderone putrido nel quale i nostri  sguazzano a meraviglia.      
L’album sarà stampato e pubblicato a Novembre 2012 da Tre Accordi Records e su vinile da Premium OTIS Recordings, entrambi i supporti distribuiti da Self, Interpunk (mailorder worldwide), Believe per il digitale  e promosso da Fleisch Ufficio Stampa.

name: 7" split Dan Vapid & The Cheats / Jetty Boys
description:
7" split 
Dan Vapid & The Cheats / Jetty Boys
2012, Merman Records (Canada)

1 original and 1 cover each by DAN VAPID AND THE CHEATS (former screeching weasel, riverdales, methadones, mopes) and 
JETTY BOYS (former screeching weasel, riverdales, leghounds).

the DVATC side features the original "One More Chance" that is reminiscent of the mopes and a cover of Pointed Sticks "Part of the Noise"

the Jetty Boys come out of the gates with "Not Even Close" a straight up pop punk gem and close out with "Jimmy" a cover of their, and this labels close pals The Roman Line.

includes MP3 download code. 

release date May 1, 2012
